etymology.description: semantic: 山(山) (shān, "mountain") + phonetic: 見(见) (xiàn, "see") = mountain shape resembling a pass -> mountain pass
etymology.interpretation: The character 岘(峴) (xiàn, "mountain pass") combines 山(山) (shān, "mountain") indicating the geographical nature of the character, with 見(见) (xiàn, "see") as a phonetic component. This combination conveys the idea of a mountain shape suggesting a pass.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 岘(峴) by removing the character elements in 見(见) (xiàn, "see") while 山(山) (shān, "mountain") remains unchanged.

examples.chinese: 古人踏云行路(古人踏雲行路)，经由岘(經由岘)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén tà yún xíng lù, jīng yóu xiàn.
examples.english: Ancient people traveled among the clouds, passing by the mountain pass.

examples.chinese: 陡峭的山路直通岘(陡峭的山路直通岘)。
examples.pinyin: Dǒu qiào de shān lù zhí tōng xiàn.
examples.english: The steep mountain road leads directly to the mountain pass.
